field.name: summary
field.value: DynamicProxy doesn't work on Medium Trust

field.name: description
field.value: The Assembly.GetName() call on IsAssemblySigned throws an exception on medium trust. This is preventing NHibernate to work on medium trust.

comment.author: jonorossi
comment.text: Fixed in r5569. GetName is no longer called. This fixes the reported issue for not working on partial trust.

comment.author: tijn
comment.text:
Unfortunately, it still didn't work under medium trust. Added another patch that should make it work. DefineDynamicModule is now called without creating debug symbols. This was the tiny extra step that was required to make it work.
Not that according to MS docs, you'll need at least .NET 2.0 SP1 to make it happen. Older versions don't allow DefineDynamicModule under medium trust at all.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: If should be OK (.NET 2sp1), we don't support earlier versions anyway IIRC.

comment.author: captainramen
comment.text: I take it this will solve the issue of NHibernate proxies (using the castle bytecode generator) not working in medium trust.

comment.author: jonorossi
comment.text: * '''Resolution''' set to ''Fixed''. * '''Version Fixed''' changed from ''1.2.0'' to ''Future''. * '''Status''' changed from ''Open'' to ''Resolved''.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: * '''Summary''' changed from ''DynamicProxy 1.1.5 doesn't work on Medium Trust'' to ''DynamicProxy doesn't work on Medium Trust''.
